intro: Phyllanthus dioicus, commonly known as the split-leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often divided into several lobes. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on separate male and female plants. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in disturbed soils or along roadsides. The species is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
